intro: Corymbis, commonly known as the corymbifolium, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melastomataceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, clustered inflorescences and often have striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals. They are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, South America, and Southeast Asia. Corymbis species typically thrive in moist, shaded environments and are often found in forest understories. Their leaves are usually opposite and have a velvety texture, adding to their ornamental appeal.
